lexUnit.name: colonize.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: extend the territory of a nation-state (or other system) by establishing other land as an area for settlement.

sentence.text: The very phrase ` the Ulster people " refers to those who originally set up the true faith in Ireland and colonized the land accordingly .
Fish began to haul themselves out of water and become the first back-boned creatures to colonise the land .
After the failure of the Crusades the crusading orders conquered and colonized Slav lands east of the Oder .
The islanders of Skyros , who had a bad name as pirates , were sold as slaves , and Athenians colonised the island .
The insects colonised the land before the vertebrates and they still exploit every organism on it .
I am heartily sick of reading letters in Points of View from folk whingeing on and on about how nasty the English are and how they are colonising Scotland .
` They were more nomadic before the whites colonised the country , and their tribal huts would be more temporary structures than council housing .
We were told in terms that it was a veritable tyranny -- Scotland was colonised by vultures and no roof beam in Scotland was free from this plague .
The Scots had come over from Ireland and colonised most of Galloway , Kintyre and Arran .
The Faroe Islands , halfway between Scotland and Iceland in the stormy North Atlantic Ocean , were colonised some 1000 years ago by the Vikings .
When sufficient deposition has occurred the area is colonised by various types of salt-loving , or halophytic , vegetation .

If the state 's bureaucracies are apparently colonized by external interest groups or socially privileged external elites , then it is because of the decisions ( or non-decisions ) of the elected governing elite .
The RSPB is concerned that persecution may be preventing their colonising the region in greater numbers .

This is one of the most historical events to the Korean people , who have been fighting against the American imperialists and their reactionary and treacherous collaborators who plot to colonize Korea .

At the end of the eighth century most of the area of present-day Yugoslavia south of the Sava-Danube line was colonised by Slav tribes , whose influence also extended into Albania and central Greece .
The most advanced northern soils are arctic brown soils , which form on damp but well-drained open slopes colonized by flowering plants .
By AD 500 , there were probably bananas in Madagascar , imported from Asia , though some authorities believe Madagascar was not in effect colonized by man until 500 years after that .
Vascular access may increase the risk of infection but cannulas are not usually colonised by organisms originating in the gut .
After the war , the succession of plants and animals that colonised these newly wasted sites was studied in detail by the London Natural History society ( LNHS ) .
